p: The density of interface was calculated based on molar percentage of the condensate and CO 2. At 132 °C, the density of supercritical CO 2, condensate gas and interface were plotted in the Fig. 8. When the pressure is 24.97 MPa, there is a stable density difference among three phases. With the pressure decreasing, the density of interface is closer to the density of supercritical CO 2. When the pressure is below 10 MPa, the densities of interface and condensate gas are exactly the same. Thus, in order to form a stable interface, it is considered that there is a certain density difference between the three phases.
